text: Fata Morgana often refers to: * Fata Morgana (mirage), an optical phenomenon * Morgan le Fay or , a sorceress in Arthurian legend Fata Morgana may also refer to: ==Film and television== * Fata Morgana (1965 film), a film by Vicente Aranda * Fata Morgana (1971 film), a film by Werner Herzog * Fata Morgana (2007 film), a film by Simon Groß * Fata Morgana (game show), a Belgian game show * "Fata Morgana" (Sanctuary), a 2008 episode of Sanctuary ==Literature== *Fata Morgana, a 1902–1910 novella by Mykhailo Kotsiubynsky *Fata Morgana, a 1904 novel by André Castaigne, illustrated by the author * "Fata Morgana", a 1939 poem by André Breton * Fata Morgana, a 1947 poem by Nikos Kavvadias * Fata Morgana, a 1977 crime novel by William Kotzwinkle * Fata Morgana, a 1992 crime novel by Roy Jacobsen * Fata Morgana, a 1999 science fiction novel by Leo Frankowski * Fata Morgana, a 2007 poetry collection by Reginald Shepherd ==Music== * "Fata Morgana Polka-mazurka", an 1868 polka by Johann Strauss II * "Fata morgana", a 1977 song by Mariza Koch (poem of Nikos Kavvadias) * "Fata Morgana", a 1980 song by Kitarō from the album Silk Road III Tun Huang * Fata Morgana, a 1984 song by Dissidenten * "Fata morgana", a 1982 song by Krypton from Formaţii Rock 7 * "Fata Morgana", a 1985 song by Erste Allgemeine Verunsicherung from Geld oder Leben! * "Fata Morgana", a 1986 song by progressive metal band Fates Warning from Awaken the Guardian * "Fatamorgana (Mirage)", a 1989 song by Ofra Haza from Desert Wind * "Fata Morgana", a 1993 song by Italian rock band Litfiba * "Fata Morgana", a 1993 song by Dana International * Fata Morgana, a 1995 album by Omar Faruk Tekbilek * Fata Morgana, a 1995 EP by Fata Morgana, a side project of Mortiis * "Fata Morgana", a 2007 song by El Guincho from Alegranza * Fata Morgana, a 2008 album by Jens Buchert * Fata Morgana, a character in Sergei Prokofiev's opera The Love for Three Oranges * Fata Morgana, a side project involving Tim Alexander of Primus * Fata Morgana, the debut album of the Hungarian metalcore band AWS released in 2011 * Nico's Last Concert: Fata Morgana, a 2000 album ==Places== * Fata Morgana (Efteling), an amusement park ride in North Brabant, Netherlands * Fata Morgana Land, a phantom island in the Arctic * Fatamorgana (photo school), an art photography school in Copenhagen, Denmark * Fonte di Fata Morgana, a 15th-century building near Florence, Italy ==Other uses== * The House in Fata Morgana, a 2012 video game ==See also== * Fata (disambiguation) * Morgana (disambiguation)
title: Fata Morgana
